alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Concho (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brown, southeastern Coleman, northern McCulloch, east central Concho and northwestern San Saba Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waldrip, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elm Grove, Winchell, Zephyr, Lohn, Brookesmith, Rockwood, Pear Valley, Doole, Stacy, Waldrip, Salt Gap, Mercury, Fife, Locker, Us- 283 Near The Mcculloch- Coleman County Line, Milburn, Whon and Indian Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
